metadata.title: CVE-2016-10396 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The racoon daemon in IPsec-Tools 0.8.2 contains a remotely exploitablecomputational-complexity attack when parsing and storing ISAKMP fragments.The implementation permits a remote attacker to exhaust computationalresources on the remote endpoint by repeatedly sending ISAKMP fragmentpackets in a particular order such that the worst-case computationalcomplexity is realized in the algorithm utilized to determine if reassemblyof the fragments can take place.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10396` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ipsec-tools - 1:0.8.2+20140711-10
racoon - 1:0.8.2+20140711-10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ipsec-tools package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:0.8.2+20140711-10').
